column2: Job Overview: As a Chemical Engineer specializing in Process, Production, and Quality Control at Hydroscope, one will assume the responsibility of sourcing and configuring equipment for carbon nanotube (CNT) based ink preparation, alongside formalizing processes for ink and sensor deposition, validation, and quality control. Expertise in nanomaterials processing, analytical chemistry, and organic synthesis becomes integral in optimizing processes and ensuring alignment with specifications. Collaboration with the multidisciplinary team at Hydroscope fosters innovation and efficiency, with objectives consistently aligned with the company's activities and R&D outcomes. Ideal candidates for this role possess a Master's or PhD in Chemical Engineering or Nano Science, with 3-5 years of post-PhD experience in chemical sensors, water quality monitoring, or nanomaterial processing, coupled with proficiency in project management, equipment setup, and documentation.  Role & responsibilities   Sourcing and setting up the necessary equipment for CNT based ink preparation Setting up and formalizing the CNK ink and sensor ink deposition process  Setting up and formalizing the validation process in ink preparation and deposition Setting up and formalizing the quality control process for ink and sensor production Reviewing process and performance reports from contractors to assess compatibility with specifications. Optimizing the various process, including developing automated process wherever possible. You will ensure consistency of your objectives and timeline with the rest of Hydroscope activities, business requirements on the one hand, R&D outcomes on the other hand. Collaborate on a daily basis with Hydroscope multi-disciplinary team, including mechanical engineering, designers, software and electronics engineers, data engineers and data scientists, water utility specialists, business developers. .  Minimum Qualification Master's / PhD degree in Chemical engineering / nano science. Experience with nanomaterials processing. Experience with analytical chemistry Experience with organic synthesis Preferred candidate profile   PhD degree in chemical engineering / Nano Science covering one or more of the following topics: nanomaterials processing, analytical chemistry, organic synthesis 3-5 years of experience after PhD working on topics related to chemical sensors or water quality monitoring or nanomaterial processing. Experience in supervising interns and technicians Experience in project management Experience in setting up research or production equipment Experience in writing process, specification and quality control documentations
column11: Nano Science, Chemistry, Chemical, Chemical Engineering, Carbon Nanotube, Research And Development, Quality Control

column2: Position Title:  Asst. Manager-Technical Services Location:  Ambala and Cuddalore  Reporting to:  Vice President- Technology Work Environment:   Independent Performer Function:  Process Development, scale up of Process from lab to commercial scale, Process Trouble Shooting at commercial   levels, Process Safety understanding    Responsibilities Preparation and implementation   of MOC (Management of Change) for the improvement of productivity as well as   cost effectiveness.  Preparation of SOP for newly   developed system or operation.  Critical process parameter   analysis during running process and operation  Automation at various stages of   Chlorination, Bromination, Hydrogenation to get consistency in product   quality. To check deviation at each stage   and control process to get quality results.  Preparation of PFD &   Reviewing P&IDs.  Responsible for process   engineering design and its implementation.  Responsible for conducting   Batches in Pilot plant and same is to be scaled up at commercial scale. Preparation of Line list and   Datasheets for Pump and Heat Exchanger calculation.  Handling hazardous material like H2 cylinder   pressure, Sodium Cyanide, Sodium Methoxide, Acetophenone, Liquor Ammonia,   Methanol, Sodium Flakes, Acetic Anhydride and Acetic Acid, Bromine, chlorine,   acetonitrile. Minimize the product cost,   Troubleshoot and resolve the issues of plant process problems, Utilities,   Equipment. Accomplished Experience in   erection of piping and equipments as per drawings and testing of pipelines   and equipments.  Training and awareness to   operators on the shop floor.  Process   and safety Interlocks preparation and periodic verification for smooth   Operation.  Commissioning experience to   achieved plant capacity by debottlenecking of process problems.  Utility Load List Preparation of   plant and prepared utility norms for the product and continuous strive to   reduce the norms in order to reduce the product cost.  Troubleshooting and   debottlenecking in Unit operations like distillation, drying, filtration,   crystallization, Evaporations etc. Good experience in handling equipment like   centrifuge operation filtration (filtration through ANF filter), ejector   operation scrubbing system, pumps PHE, FBD, RCVD, Heat Exchangers, Pumps etc. Plant safety audit to maintain   all equipment & working place in good condition to avoid any near misses   & accidents by regular schedule. Maintained 5S in plant in order   to keep sound housekeeping. Having practical knowledge of the   Works permit system. Plan and undertake production,   motivate production team and achieve productivity and quality targets. Ensure compliance of statutory   safety requirements and Standard Operating Procedures. Possess knowledge of chemical   processes, operating parameters and trouble shooting in the plant.   Educational & Training Requirements: BE, B. Tech, ME or M. Tech (Chem. Engg.)   Knowledge, Experience and   Skills:  5+ years of experience in the field of Process R&D and technology transfer of Agrochemical Technical Molecules    Other Requirements:  Decision Making, Openness and   Transparency, Trust, Strong Team Player
